results.title: Amelioration of human allograft arterial injury by atorvastatin or simvastatin correlates with reduction of interferon-gamma production by infiltrating T cells.
results.text_hl: The effects of statins on T-cell alloresponses to vascular endothelial cells were also investigated in vitro. RESULTS: @<m>DISEASE_Arteriosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001161 @@@Graft arteriosclerosis@@@-like @DISEASE_Carotid_Artery_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D020212 @@@arteriopathy@@@ induced by PBMCs was reduced by @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ at 30 mg/kg/day or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ at 100 mg/kg/day that correlated with decreased graft-infiltrating CD3+ T cells.

citations.NLM: Yi T, Rao DA, Tang PC, Wang Y, Cuchara LA, Bothwell AL, Colangelo CM, Tellides G, Pober JS, Lorber MI. Amelioration of human allograft arterial injury by atorvastatin or simvastatin correlates with reduction of interferon-gamma production by infiltrating T cells. Transplantation. 2008 Sep 15;86(5):719-27. PMID: 18791454

results.title: Simvastatin and oxidative stress in humans: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled clinical trial
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment leads to a reduction in fluxes in mitochondrial respiratory complexes I and II and might thereby reduce the formation of @CHEMICAL_Reactive_Oxygen_Species @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017382 @@@reactive oxygen species@@@, which have been implicated in the pathogenesis of @<m>DISEASE_Arteriosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001161 @@@arteriosclerosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Rasmussen ST, Andersen JT, Nielsen TK, Cejvanovic V, Petersen KM, Henriksen T, Weimann A, Lykkesfeldt J, Poulsen HE. Simvastatin and oxidative stress in humans: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled clinical trial Redox Biol. 2016 Oct;9():32-38. PMID: 27281490

results.title: Effect of polycan, a beta-glucan originating from Aureobasidium, on a high-fat diet-induced hyperlipemic hamster model
results.text_hl: In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIMVA@@@-treated group, body weight (P<0.05), the serum level of @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglyceride@@@, T-CHOL and LDL; P<0.01) and the level of @<m>DISEASE_Arteriosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001161 @@@arteriosclerosis@@@ (P<0.01) were significantly reduced when compared with the vehicle control group.

citations.NLM: Lim MK, Ku SK, Choi JS, Kim JW. Effect of polycan, a beta-glucan originating from Aureobasidium, on a high-fat diet-induced hyperlipemic hamster model Exp Ther Med. 2015 Apr;9(4):1369-1378. PMID: 25780437

results.title: A pharmacoeconomic evaluation of statins in the treatment of hypercholesterolaemia in the primary care setting in Spain.
results.text_hl: MAIN MEASUREMENTS AND RESULTS: After 6 months, the therapeutic goals of LDL-C control, according to the recommendations of the Spanish Society of @<m>DISEASE_Arteriosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001161 @@@Arteriosclerosis@@@--Consensus-2000, were reached in 62.5%, 43.8%, 45.5% and 40.5% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, respectively.

citations.NLM: Tárraga-López PJ, Celada-Rodríguez A, Cerdán-Oliver M, Solera-Albero J, Ocaña-López JM, López-Cara MA, De Miguel-Clave J. A pharmacoeconomic evaluation of statins in the treatment of hypercholesterolaemia in the primary care setting in Spain. Pharmacoeconomics. 2005;23(3):275-87. PMID: 15836008
citations.BibTeX: @article{15836008, title={A pharmacoeconomic evaluation of statins in the treatment of hypercholesterolaemia in the primary care setting in Spain.}, author={Tárraga-López PJ and Celada-Rodríguez A and Cerdán-Oliver M and Solera-Albero J and Ocaña-López JM and López-Cara MA and De Miguel-Clave J}, journal={Pharmacoeconomics}, volume={23}, number={3}, pages={275-87}}

results.title: [The pharmacological treatment of hypercholesterolemia].
results.text_hl: Comparing the three statin drugs, @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, the latter has recently been shown in study 4S to be effective in reducing global and coronary mortality in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a history of @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Pérez Jiménez F. [The pharmacological treatment of hypercholesterolemia]. Rev Esp Cardiol. 1995;48 Suppl 5():31-8. PMID: 7494938
